p: Epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG) is extracted from Camelia sinensis and is the most bioactive molecule in both green and black tea. It possesses antiangiogenic, pro-apoptotic and anti-proliferative effects [ 90] and due to its pharmaceutical effects, it could be used in the future in the management of endometriosis. No clinical trials on humans have been conducted until present. However, the results of the experiments realized on animals provided promising perspectives.
